dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So get this. Luckin's sales, right, in the third quarter? Up five hundred and sixty-five percent from last year. Five hundred and sixty-five percent, B!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So get this. Luckin's sales, right, in the third quarter? Up five hundred and sixty-five percent from last year. Five hundred and sixty-five percent, B!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckins stock was also powered upward by a company report earlier this week that its sales in the third quarter soared to $208.9 million, an increase of 558% from a year earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, I saw that. And they lost eighty-five million dollars in that same quarter. Eighty-five million, A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, I saw that. And they lost eighty-five million dollars in that same quarter. Eighty-five million, A.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckin is also struggling to make money its loss widened in the third quarter to $82 million (see details here).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But the growth! Five hundred and sixty-five percent! Who cares about short-term losses when you're growing like that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the growth! Five hundred and sixty-five percent! Who cares about short-term losses when you're growing like that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckins stock was also powered upward by a company report earlier this week that its sales in the third quarter soared to $208.9 million, an increase of 558% from a year earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I care about losses! That's, like, not sustainable. They're just burning cash, trying to, um, buy market share.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I care about losses! That's, like, not sustainable. They're just burning cash, trying to, um, buy market share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They're disrupting the market! They went from twelve hundred stores to thirty-eight hundred stores in a year. That's, you know, not burning cash, that's rapid expansion!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're disrupting the market! They went from twelve hundred stores to thirty-eight hundred stores in a year. That's, you know, not burning cash, that's rapid expansion!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckin by the end of the third quarter had 3,680 stores compared with 1,189 a year earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Rapid expansion that costs them dearly. Starbucks has a hundred and ten billion market cap. Luckin's, what, six point six? And losing money!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Rapid expansion that costs them dearly. Starbucks has a hundred and ten billion market cap. Luckin's, what, six point six? And losing money!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fridays stock surge left Luckins market cap at $6.4 billion... To be sure, Luckin still has a long way to go overall in matching Starbucks, whose market cap of nearly $100 billion and global presence tower above Luckins.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but look at the CEO, Jenny Qian. She's a billionaire now! From a company founded in 2017. That's, uh, insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but look at the C E O, Jenny Qian. She's a billionaire now! From a company founded in twenty seventeen. That's, uh, insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big increase in Luckins shares on Friday also turned Luckins CEO Jenny Zhiya Qian into a billionaire, with a holding worth $1.06 billion. Shares in Luckin, which was founded in only 2017...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A billionaire on paper, maybe. It's all built on, like, speculation. This feels like a tech bubble, you know, for coffee.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A billionaire on paper, maybe. It's all built on, like, speculation. This feels like a tech bubble, you know, for coffee.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, you're just being cynical. This is, um, the new way of doing business in China. You go big, then you figure out profitability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, you're just being cynical. This is, um, the new way of doing business in China. You go big, then you figure out profitability.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Or you go big and then you collapse. I've seen that story too many times, A. Eighty-five million in losses? That's a red flag.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or you go big and then you collapse. I've seen that story too many times, A. Eighty-five million in losses? That's a red flag.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckin is also struggling to make money its loss widened in the third quarter to $82 million (see details here).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's a flag that says they're investing in growth! They're taking on Starbucks, a giant, and they're making waves. The article even says that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a flag that says they're investing in growth! They're taking on Starbucks, a giant, and they're making waves. The article even says that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet theres no denying that Luckin is making waves in the coffee and tea business in a key market for Starbucks...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Making waves while drowning in debt, potentially. A spirited rival, sure, but, like, a fragile one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Making waves while drowning in debt, potentially. A spirited rival, sure, but, like, a fragile one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the U.S. company is up against a spirited rival that wasnt on the map not long ago.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fragile? They've climbed sixty percent since going public this May! That's not fragile, that's, uh, momentum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fragile? They've climbed sixty percent since going public this May! That's not fragile, that's, uh, momentum.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares in Luckin... have now climbed more than 59% since the company went public in May this year at a price of $17 a share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Momentum that could turn on a dime when investors realize they're not making money. It's not magic, it's just coffee, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Momentum that could turn on a dime when investors realize they're not making money. It's not magic, it's just coffee, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's smart coffee. You just don't get the vision, B.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's smart coffee. You just don't get the vision, B.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I get the numbers, A. And those numbers, um, they don't lie about the losses.
